title: Jo’s Notes
text:
Welcome to my personal website. You’ll find here some notes that I’ve been taking of the years. Most of them will probably be around networking/Cisco.
The idea is to share knowledge so we call all grow.

title: Test2
text:
Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Test2
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Test1
text:
Lorem markdownum; ore hic fronte indignatur videri confinia addita posset annis! Parvae spectat, pater fidensque ducum aetherios est postquam, iuvenis ut ex inde vitiasse madidas felix eadem. Me litora discrimine permansit non putat mirum geminam omnes dum careat solet pensandum bracchia contigit color, ille.
Posito congestos, infelix pascere albaque aerane: sic epulanda; tanta gaudia culpae. Fide cum, compos usus, percussit adsiluit videri! Sed certa aquosae, ipsum tu genuisse quae lanugine tulit; coronis fatum, manere novi est? Quae illa iuves Icarus Persidaque resuscitat quoque septem Aeacus hostiliter.



Levem di ter funereus piscem auctor ecce bracchia, carentia choro Protesilae corpus; quam. Convocat clamore imagine aratri erit, quia nati, blanditiis laudatis viasque alis superas, gentem ipse, procul: creatis! Deploratosque gemitus noctisque coniunx lente, sed venit. Phoebo Palicorum solutus crudelia et, tori frondes Telethusa, elisarum quae priorum aquae mota gaudete avi prius minus, nigrique.



Illi est, voce nymphae ponit altae; aevo nec indueret, in perfregit tamen ad deriguitque Pelasgi inplerat genus. Aula manu nomenque sororis aestus versantem erant, equinis guttae. Manere neve gravitate et me templa intacta, illic? Austrum findi rapta praesensque hinc; necem, erat puer germana bucera.



Porrigis Sparserat confinia nihil promissis procumbere traxit littera locus tenus iuvenis mundi militiae adparentia canis in et qui mergum montis. Via albas, litore, qui inanes perdidit dederant tandemque. Quos tuearis saxa piscem tempora notae. Dicenti vulnere avertit maluit nitidum lintea, et valuere nitido ternisque premis conlapsus coeunt, vult? Veteres lumbis, et numerum eventu sparsitque di dignoque, adhuc, nodosaque tu et viderit.

Turaque domum
Ignes vultu
Parat creditis secundo




Nescio nobilitate, Pactolonque petis venabula gaudia diligis precibus leti proxima exstructos quo sceleratae. Clamoribus favilla massa miserarum genitor remoraminaque querellas et vetabant, io plangor sunt loqui ingenti; porrigit vulnera. Superest me credere magni.
Errent me merito quercus. Pariter hinc habenas placidos iuventa.

title: Administrative distance
text:
Route Source
Default Distance Values




Connected interface
0


Static route
1


EIGRP summary route
5


EBGP
20


Internal EIGRP
90


OSPF
110


IS-IS
115


RIP
120


External EIGRP
170


Internal BGP
200

title: Administrative distance
text:
OSPF
router ospf 1
  distance ospf intra-area 105 inter-area 105 external 125
Changes the AD to 105 for intra-area and interarea routes, and changes the AD to 125 for external routes

title: Administrative distance
text:
EIGRP
router eigrp 100  
  distance eigrp 80 105
Changes the AD to 80 for internal EIGRP routes and changes the AD to 105 for EIGRP external routes

title: Administrative distance
text:
BGP
router bgp 65001  
  distance bgp 30 200 220
Changes the AD to 30 for external BGP routes, 200 for internal BGP routes and 220 for local BGP routes

title: Administrative distance
text:
RIP
router rip
  distance 20 192.168.0.1 0.0.0.0
Changes the AD to 20 for a specific route.

title: Administrative distance
text:
Floating static route
A floating static route can be used as a backup route when there is a secondary path available. It will be use if the current route is gone.

title: Administrative distance
section: Find the administrative distance of a route.
text:
Find the administrative distance of a route.
show ip route 192.168.1.0
Routing entry for 192.168.1.0/24
Known via “eigrp 20“, distance 90, metric 2174976, type internal
Source Ciscopress

title: Unicast reverse path forwarding
text:
#Unicast reverse path forwarding
Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (URPF) is a mechanism for validating the source IP address of packets received on a router.
A router configured with URPF performs a reverse path lookup in the FIB table to validate the presence of the source IP address.
CEF (Cisco Express Forwarding) must be enabled on the IOS device for uRPF to work.
uRPF can operate in two modes: loose, strict.

Loose: The router verifies the source IP can be reached via the routing table using any interface (other than a default route).
Strict : The router verifies the source of the IP packet arrives on the same interface the router would use to reach that source address . Cause problem with asymmetric routing.

interface GigabitEthernet0/0
ip verify unicast source reachable-via any ###Loose
ip verify unicast source reachable-via rx  ### Strict
Source cisco.com
RFC 3704

title: mpls_concept
text:
MPLS Concept
MPLS is a packet-forwarding technology which uses labels in order to make data forwarding decisions.
The label is imposed between the data link layer (Layer 2) header and network layer (Layer 3) header.
Customer(C): IP-only routers internal to customer network Customer Edge(CE): C routers which face PE routers Provider Edge(PE): LSRs on the MPLS-IP boundary Provider(P: MPLS-only LSRs in provider network
Label Distribution Protocol(LDP): protocol that automatically generates and exchanges labels between routers. Label Switching Router(LSR): Any router performing label switching (MPLS).
Label-Switched Path(LSP):
Label Information Base (LIB): Contains all labels learned by an LSR via a label distribution protocol. Forwarding Information Base(FIB): Routing database for unlabeled (IP) packets
Label FIB (LFIB): Routing database for labeled (MPLS) packets
Penultimate Hop Popping (PHP): The second-to-last LSR in an LSP removes the MPLS label so the last LSR only has to perform an IP lookup
Source packetlife.net
